website_summaries.verdict: A good choice for anyone who doesn't want to spend too much on a watch that's best worn for special occasions, as it's not durable enough for everyday wear.
pros: Generates enthusiasm from men who prefer a fuss-free, minimalist design
Classic leather strap and sleek, silver-tone face in stainless steel
Suitable for semi-formal and dressy occasions
cons: Fairly lightweight – a plus for some men
while others prefer a more substantial watch
Water resistant only to about 98 feet

customer_reviews.title: This watch brings back wonderful memories, every time I wear it
customer_reviews.text: Shortly after my wife and I were married (over 40 years ago), my wife purchased an original automatic-wind Bulova dress watch for me, for Christmas. Because we lived in Manhattan, NYC, at the time, my wife bought the watch from Bulova's original shop on Maiden Lane, in lower Manhattan. The original Bulova watch is long gone, but, when I saw the brand on Amazon, so many fond memories were brought back that I have since purchased two Bulova dress watches on Amazon, including one that resembled the gift from my wife.. Every time I wear these watches, I think of the early days of our marriage; it makes me smile.
customer_reviews.author: R Dwyer

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking and well-sized, but uncomfortable due to lug design
customer_reviews.text: It looks great and is the perfect size for someone who wants a small, sleek wristwatch. However, there are two drawbacks which cause me to deduct stars: 1. Poor lug design. The lugs curve inwards, which is nice for those with smaller wrists. However, the inside edges of the lugs are squarish and a bit pointy. They pressed uncomfortably against my wrists and left marks. 2. The leather strap seemed extremely thin and flimsy. I wanted to like the watch, but I simply couldn't wear it comfortably because of the lug design. I returned it for a refund.

customer_reviews.title: Elegant and minimalist
customer_reviews.text: Bulova brand have seen better times, but this watch is very nice. I like very much the size and the clean face, only the hour and minute hands (no seconds hand) and the little window for the date. The Bulova "tuning fork" symbol at 12:00 looks very nice, although the watch not have a tuning fork movement (ahhh, the Accutron, what a great watch) but a simple and cheap japanese quartz movement. In short, a very decent watch for use at work or in those occasions where we have to look more elegant.

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I like this watch a lot. It's really thin and light weight. It's so quiet that I can't hear ticking unless it's actually touching my ear. Terrific accuracy--I've had it one week and it has not lost a second. Looks great. The hands and accents are all polished. The face is perfectly brushed steel which is hard to see in the pics.

customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Overall - a nice watch
customer_reviews.text: Overall, this is a very nice watch. It's very thin and lightweight, so it fits very well under shirt cuffs and jackets. It also looks very classy and can be worn with almost anything. The face isn't white like the picture suggests, but is more of a silver sunburst pattern. At the same time though, the fact that it's so light makes it feel a little cheaper when it's on your wrist compared to heavier automatic watches. The band that comes with the watch isn't great, but it's relatively easy (and cheap to replace), if desired.
